gname: Riyadus-Salikhin Reconnaissance and Sabotage Battalion of Chechen Martyrs
summary: A train traveling between Moscow and St. Petersburg was derailed by a bomb planted underneath the trains tracks in the city of Veliky Novgorod, Novgorod Oblast, Russia. The blast injured sixty. Chechen militants claimed responsibility for the attack

At least 5 people were killed and another 12 were injured when an explosive device detonated on or near a bus in the Russian Republic of North Ossetia in the countrys southwest. Police suspected that Chechen rebels were to blame, but no group claimed responsibility.

gname: Riyadus-Salikhin Reconnaissance and Sabotage Battalion of Chechen Martyrs
summary: A Chechen Patrol-Sentry Service post was attacked with gunfire, killing one officer and wounding two others. The attack occurred in the Leninsky district of Chechnyas capital city, Grozny. No group claimed responsibility, but Chechen rebels are suspected of perpetrating the attack.

A government official of the Chechen Patrol-Sentry Service was attacked and killed while in his car in Grozny, Chechnya. No one claimed responsibility for the attack, but Chechen rebels are suspected of perpetrating it.

One Russian police officer was wounded when Chechen separatists in a Lada automobile fired small arms (automatic rifles) at two Federal Security Bureau vehicles in the afternoon two kilometers outside of Berkat-Yurt, Grozny District, Republic of Chechnya, Russian Federation.   No claim of responsibility was reported.
